answers.answer: Thank you for your post on our forum…My name is Ardy and I am one of the JDRF volunteers that respond to question.  I must let you know as volunteers we are not able to give medical advice but respond based on our personal experience with type 1 diabetes, for me I am mom to Jeff who was diagnosed at the age of 11 and is now 38 years old.You didn’t indicate in your post if you have diabetes be it type 1 or type 2 or if your question is more of a general nature.  Regardless there are any number of reasons this could be happening to you.  But you really need to speak with your doctor and ask his or her advice as to tests that should be run.Sorry I couldn’t provide you with more information, but based on what you said it is very difficult.Ardy

question: i havent been feeling right lately.  ive figured that 2 hours after i eat i begin to feel a headache, and a bit nauseas i have low energy level what could this be?
title: 2 hours after a meal
